born 20 November 1987) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref name="htafc_2018-06-01">{{cite news | date= 1 June 2018 | url= https://www.htafc.com/news/2018/june/transfer-ben-hamer-to-join-town-on-1-july/ |title=TRANSFER: BEN HAMER TO JOIN TOWN ON 1 JULY | accessdate= 1 June 2018}}</ref>
==Career== ===Early career=== Hamer was born in [[Chard, Somerset]] and is a [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] fan.<ref>{{cite news | date= 11 September 2012 | url= http://www.southlondon-today.co.uk/Sport.cfm?id=31431&headline=Ben | title= Ben Hamer can't wait for Charlton derby test | work= southlondon-today.co.uk/Sport | accessdate= 11 September 2012 | deadurl= yes | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20131216005849/http://www.southlondon-today.co.uk/Sport.cfm?id=31431&headline=Ben | archivedate= 16 December 2013 | df= dmy-all}}</ref> His family moved to Germany at the age of 3 and, consequently, he is a fluent German speaker. However, when he was 8, his family came back to England. He attended Holyrood Community School in Chard which is near to his birthplace. His footballing ability led to a spell playing for [[Somerset]] at county level, where he was spotted by a Reading scout. He signed for Reading at the age of 15.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}}
===Reading=== ====Loan to Crawley Town==== Having risen through the youth academy at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], Hamer went on loan to [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]] for the [[2006–07 in English football|2006–07]] season, where he missed just one league game and was named as Player of the Season.<ref>{{cite news | date=9 October 2006 | url=http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~908887,00.html | archive-url=https://archive.is/20120805125113/http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~908887,00.html | dead-url=yes | archivedate=5 August 2012 | title=Osano impresses as a number of youngsters benefit from current loans | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=9 October 2006}}</ref>
====Loans to Brentford==== On 4 July 2007, Hamer signed a new one-year contract to keep him at Reading until the end of the [[2007–08 in English football|2007–08]] season.<ref>{{cite news | date=4 July 2007 | url=http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1067116,00.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080411130459/http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~1067116%2C00.html | archivedate=11 April 2008 | title=Four new contracts agreed | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=7 July 2007 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all}}</ref> He joined [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] in an initial one-month loan deal on 11 August 2007,<ref>{{cite news | date=11 August 2007 | url=http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1088849,00.html | archive-url=https://archive.is/20120805154025/http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1088849,00.html | dead-url=yes | archivedate=5 August 2012 | title=Royals agree another loan move | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=13 September 2007}}</ref> which was subsequently extended to 14 October 2007.<ref>{{cite news | date=12 September 2007 | url=http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1110607,00.html | archive-url=https://archive.is/20120805123353/http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1110607,00.html | dead-url=yes | archivedate=5 August 2012 | title=Youngster loan deal extended | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=13 September 2007}}</ref> Brentford re-signed Hamer in an emergency loan deal on 1 January 2008, following an injury to their first choice 'keeper, [[Simon Brown (footballer, born 1976)|Simon Brown]].<ref>{{cite news | date=1 January 2008 | url=http://www.brentfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~1203220,00.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080104140406/http://www.brentfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10421~1203220%2C00.html | archivedate=4 January 2008 | title=Ben returns | publisher=Brentford F.C. | accessdate=1 January 2008 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 28 January 2008, his loan was extended to the end of the 2007–08 season.<ref>{{cite news | date=28 January 2008 | url=http://www.brentfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~1226609,00.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080409131839/http://www.brentfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10421~1226609%2C00.html | archivedate=9 April 2008 | title=Ben's Loan Extended | publisher=Brentford F.C. | accessdate=28 January 2008 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He signed a new one-year deal with Reading and returned to Brentford for a third loan spell on a season-long loan on 17 June, and was [[Andy Scott (footballer, born 1972)|Andy Scott]]'s first choice goalkeeper for the [[2008–09 in English football|2008–09]] season, in which Brentford were champions of [[Football League Two|League Two]].<ref>{{cite news | date=17 June 2008 | url=http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1329888,00.html | archive-url=https://archive.is/20120805155311/http://www.readingfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1329888,00.html | dead-url=yes | archivedate=5 August 2012 | title=Hamer signs deal & makes loan move | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=17 June 2008}}</ref> As well as winning a League Two Champions medal, Hamer also won the Puma Golden Glove award for League 2 having recorded 20 clean sheets within the season.<ref>{{cite news | date=21 May 2009 | url=http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~1663230,00.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090526192608/http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10421~1663230%2C00.html | archivedate=26 May 2009 | title=Ben scoops award | publisher=Brentford F.C. | accessdate=22 May 2009 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was also the only Brentford player to successfully hit the crossbar in [[Soccer AM]]'s Crossbar Challenge.
On 18 June 2009, Hamer signed a new two-year contract and was expected to jostle with [[Adam Federici]] for the Number 1 jersey. On 31 August, Hamer was loaned back to Brentford for a fourth spell with the Bees.<ref>{{cite news | date=18 June 2009 | url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1694724,00.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314020741/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~1694724%2C00.html | archivedate=14 March 2012 | title=Hamer signs two-year deal | publisher=Reading F.C. | accessdate=18 June 2009 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | date=18 June 2009 | url=http://www.getbracknell.co.uk/sport/football/readingfc/s/2052759_ben_hamer_signs_new_reading_fc_deal | title=Exeter City sign Reading keeper Ben Hamer on loan | publisher=getbracknell.co.uk| accessdate=18 June 2009}}</ref>
====Loan to Exeter City==== On 18 January 2011, Hamer joined [[Football League One|League One]] side [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] on a three-month loan deal.<ref>{{cite news | date=19 January 2011 | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/e/exeter_city/9366400.stm| title=Ben Hamer signs new Reading FC deal | publisher=BBC Sport| accessdate=19 January 2011}}</ref> Hamer made his [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] debut against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on 22 January 2011.
===Charlton Athletic=== [[File:Ben Hamer 05-05-2012 2.jpg|thumb|upright|Hamer celebrating winning the [[EFL League One|League One]] title with [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] in 2012]]
On 1 August 2011, Hamer joined [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] on a three-year contract and was immediately handed the number one jersey.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10267~2406920,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110919062441/http://www.cafc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10267~2406920%2C00.html |archivedate=19 September 2011 |title=Keeper captured |date=1 August 2011 |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |accessdate=30 June 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He made his debut on 23 August 2011 against his former club Reading in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] first round and helped Charlton to a 2 – 1 win. After some initial nervous performances he cemented his place in the team, making crucial saves throughout Charlton's title winning [[Football League One|League One]] [[2011–12 Charlton Athletic F.C. season|campaign]].{{citation needed|date=February 2013}} He clinched promotion to the [[Football League Championship|Championship]] with [[Chris Powell]]'s side in April 2012, with a 1 – 0 win over [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] and continued to play regularly for the Addicks during the [[2012–13 Charlton Athletic F.C. season|2012–13 season]]. A series of injuries resulted in hamer playing fewer matches in the [[2013–14 Charlton Athletic F.C. season|2013–14 season]].
===Leicester City=== After several weeks of strong speculation about Hamer's move to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], it was finally confirmed on 22 May 2014, by Hamer himself on social media. Hamer says he made the move to the newly promoted Foxes for the chance to play Premier League football.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/BenHamer21/status/469488874109284352|title=Delighted To Have Joined @OfficialFoxes|author= |date=22 May 2014 |work= |publisher=Ben Hamer|accessdate=22 May 2014}}</ref> He made his debut in a 1–0 defeat at home to [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] in a [[Football League Cup|Capital One Cup]] second round tie. Following an injury to [[Kasper Schmeichel]] whilst on international duty, Hamer made his [[Premier League]] debut on 13 September, putting in a very good performance and keeping a clean sheet as Leicester secured a 1–0 win at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], their first victory since returning to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090535|title=Stoke 0–1 Leicester|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 September 2014}}</ref>
He played his second game for Leicester against Premier League champions, [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in a 0–1 home defeat on 13 December. After playing 7 games for Leicester, Hamer lost his place when on 6 January 2015, Leicester signed experienced goalkeeper [[Mark Schwarzer]] from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] to help cover for the injured [[Kasper Schmeichel]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/leicester-city-sign-mark-schwarzer-2186274.aspx|title=Leicester City Sign Mark Schwarzer|publisher=Leicester City F.C.|date=6 January 2015|accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> In the 2016–17 season, Hamer started Leicester's sixth Champions League group game, giving him his Champions League debut. Leicester lost 5–0 to [[FC Porto]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38226552 |title=Champions League - Group G |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 December 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Nottingham Forest==== On 25 July 2015, Hamer joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Reds secure Hamer |url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/reds-secure-hamer-2570519.aspx |publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C. |date=25 July 2015}}</ref> However, he returned to Leicester on 4 August after the loan was cut short due to Nottingham Forest's financial issues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Leicester-City-goalkeeper-Ben-Hamer-returns/story-27542878-detail/story.html|title=Leicester City goalkeeper Ben Hamer returns from Nottingham Forest loan over financial issues|work=Leicester Mercury|date=4 August 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150807003235/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Leicester-City-goalkeeper-Ben-Hamer-returns/story-27542878-detail/story.html|archivedate=7 August 2015}}</ref>
====Loan to Bristol City==== On 11 August 2015, Hamer joined Championship side [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on season-long loan deal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Hamer joins for the season |url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/hamer-joins-for-the-season-2609819.aspx? |publisher=Bristol City F.C. |date=11 August 2015 |accessdate=12 August 2015}}</ref> However, he returned to Leicester City on 17 November 2015 after making only five appearances for the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/hamer-heads-back-to-leicester-2804490.aspx|title=Hamer heads back to Leicester|publisher=Bristol City F.C. |date=17 November 2015}}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town=== On 1 June 2018, [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] announced the signing of Hamer on a free transfer once his contract ended on 1 July.<ref name="htafc_2018-06-01"/>
